title: [HUDI-7841] RLI and secondary index should consider only pruned partitions for file skipping
body:
### Change Logs

Even though RLI scans only matching files, it tries to get those candidate files by iterating over all files from file index. See - https://github.com/apache/hudi/blob/f4be74c29471fbd6afff472f8db292e6b1f16f05/hudi-spark-datasource/hudi-spark-common/src/main/scala/org/apache/hudi/RecordLevelIndexSupport.scala#L47

Instead, it can use the `prunedPartitionsAndFileSlices` to only consider pruned partitions whenever there is a partition predicate.

### Impact

NA

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

title: [HUDI-7845] Call show_fsview_latest procedure support path_regex
body:
### Change Logs

Currently `show_fsview_all` support set `path_regex`, e.g.
```sql
call show_fsview_all(table => '$tableName', path_regex => 'day=d1/hh=h2')
call show_fsview_all(table => '$tableName', path_regex => 'day=d1/*/')
```

while `show_fsview_latest` only support set `partition_path`, e.g.
```sql
call show_fsview_latest(table => '$tableName', partition_path => 'day=d1/hh=h2')
```

This PR make `show_fsview_latest` support `path_regex` too, In fact, `partition_path` can be completely replaced by  `path_regex`, but for compatibility with old versions, we keep it

### Impact

`show_fsview_latest` support  `path_regex`

Other fixs:

- change `partition_path` in `show_fsview_latest` from required to optional
- fix `call show_fsview_latest` when no commits in timeline

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

### Documentation Update

will update the doc of `call show_fsview_latest`

title: [HUDI-7269] Fallback to key based merge if positions are missing from log block
body:
### Change Logs

Fallback to key based merging if positions are missing from a log block when doing position based read in the fg reader.

Changes:

Make position based buffer extend key based buffer so we can fall back to key based buffer.

Move some position based logic (shouldSkip (maybe should be in key buffer?) and extractRecordPositions) from the base buffer into the position buffer because that is the only place it is used.

If a log block is found to not have positions, we call a method to convert the map to use keys instead of positions: fallbackToKeyBasedBuffer(). This conversion is not completely effective because delete records may not have key stored. We set a flag "needToDoHybridStrategy" to true and then handle this issue when merging with the base file. We don't remove those records from the map. We know that there will not be any collisions because positions are stored as long and recordkeys are stored as string. When we merge with the base file, we get the position from the base record and search the map for it. If we find a record, then we know it is a delete because only deletes have this issue. Additionally, we know that this delete is the most recent version of the record. That is because we process logs from newest to oldest. And these deletes occurred before the fallback. Therefore, they are newer than any versions of the record with a key.  Additionally, since deletes with positions don't have source ordering, we apply overwrite with latest logic. Finally, we get the key from the base record and delete it from the map if there is another occurrence of it. 

In shouldSkip, I moved the check for keys.isEmpty to the beginning so that we don't need to read the recordkey from the record each time. 

I added TestPositionBasedMergingFallback to test different scenarios where we need to fallback

I modified TestCustomMerger and TestEventTimeMerging to also test position based merging and position based fallback. Additionally, I added TestOverwriteWithLatestMerger so that we could test position only deletes and hybrid merge strategy.

### Impact

Reads with position merging will not fail if there are log blocks without positions. 

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

### Documentation Update

N/A

### Contributor's checklist

- [ ] Read through [contributor's guide](https://hudi.apache.org/contribute/how-to-contribute)
- [ ] Change Logs and Impact were stated clearly
- [ ] Adequate tests were added if applicable
- [ ] CI passed

title: [HUDI-7390] fix: HoodieStreamer no longer works without --props being supplied
body:
When attempting to run HoodieStreamer without a props file, specifying all required extra configuration via --hoodie-conf parameters, the execution fails and an exception is thrown:  
`HoodieIOException: Cannot read properties from dfs from file file:/private/tmp/hudi-props-repro/src/test/resources/streamer-config/dfs-source.properties`  

### Change Logs

When --props is not provided in command, then `propsFilePath` is set to default DEFAULT_DFS_SOURCE_PROPERTIES. So, if propsFilePath == DEFAULT_DFS_SOURCE_PROPERTIES, we should not try to read props file.

title: [HUDI-7840] Add position merging to the new file group reader
body:
### Change Logs

Position merging was removed in [HUDI-7567](https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/10957)
but will now be added back with additional testing and proper use of filters.

Add position based merging for bootstrap.

Some filters can be pushed down if we have record positions for bootstrap. We exclude any filters that involve both the skeleton file and base file.

No filters can be pushed down for MOR except required filters. I think required filters need to be investigated more in a followup ticket as well.

Add HoodiePositionBasedSchemaHandler to add position column to the schema if appropriate. That case is when the reader context supports adding record positions. As opposed to shouldUseRecordPosition which is controlled by a config and can be used even when record positions are not supported by the reader context.

Added tests for choosing bootstrap filters. Also added functional tests to ensure bootstrap and mor do not push down filters when they are not supposed to. SQLConf.PARQUET_RECORD_FILTER_ENABLED must be enabled to test this properly as I did in the test. 

Added back the test files with some minor modifications: TestSpark35RecordPositionMetadataColumn
TestHoodiePositionBasedFileGroupRecordBuffer

### Impact

positional merge feature added back to fg reader.
Bootstrap reading can be sped up with positional merging

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

medium
wrote tests

title: [MINOR] Correct order of test services start in `UtilitiesTestBase`
body:
### Change Logs

For now, all uses of `initTestServices()` are with `needsHdfs=false`, `needsHive=false`, `needsZookeeper=false`, except `HoodieDeltaStreamerTestBase`, where `needsHive=true`. So there is no problem with `initTestServices()` for now. But if we switch `needsZookeeper` to `true`, then we will face errors of Hive connection to Zookeeper in `HoodieDeltaStreamerTestBase`.
Correct order of services start:
1. Zookeeper
2. HDFS
3. Hive

Also fixed `cleanUpUtilitiesTestServices()` ordering, in reverse to corresponding initializations.

title: Deltastreamer changes to add support for reading kafka commit offsets from Kafka instead of Hoodie Commit Timeline.
body:
### Change Logs

Deltastreamer changes to add support for reading kafka commit offsets from Kafka instead of Hoodie Commit Timeline.

### Impact

The change will not have any impact unless the config flag `--disable-hoodie-commit-checkpoint` is added.

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

Low

### Documentation Update

New config added : `--disable-hoodie-commit-checkpoint`.
If this flag is provided, then the Deltastreamer will not read the start offset from the hoodie commit timeline and get it from the source (Kafka commit offset for example). This may not be used for DFS or sources where the source can not keep track of the consumer offset. With kafka source, this might need additional configuration `hoodie.deltastreamer.source.kafka.enable.commit.offset=true` and `auto.offset.reset=group` so that kafka is committed appropriately and offset is fetched from the kafka group.

title: [HUDI-7824] Fixing incr cleaner with savepoint removal
body:
### Change Logs

Whenever a savepoint is removed, cleaner should resort to do entire partition cleaning instead of incr cleaning. We already attempted a fix https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/10651, but it had a bug where not all partitions were accounted for. Whenever a savepoint is removed, cleaner should just resort to full partition cleaning. Anyways, savepoint meta files are deleted and savepoint will be tracking every latest base file for every partition, it makes sense to do entire partition list cleaning.

### Impact

Whenever a savepoint is removed, cleaner should resort to do entire partition cleaning instead of incr cleaning.

title: [HUDI-7817] Use Jackson Core instead of org.codehaus.jackson for JSON encoding

`org.codehaus.jackson` is a older version of Jackson Core (`com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core`).  `org.codehaus.jackson:jackson-mapper-asl` has critical vulnerabilities ([CWE-502](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/502.html) | [CVE-2019-10202](https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2019-10202) | [CVSS 9.8](https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.1#CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H) | [SNYK-JAVA-ORGCODEHAUSJACKSON-3326362](https://app.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGCODEHAUSJACKSON-3326362)), which should be avoided.  This PR changes `JsonEncoder` to use Jackson Core and adds rules to check illegal imports of `org.codehaus.jackson`.

title: [HUDI-7655] Ensuring clean action executor cleans up all intended files
body:
### Change Logs

This patch is for branch-0-x. Master patch https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/11343
We can't let clean action executor skip files to be deleted. Due to networking glitches, there are chances some files may not be cleaned up. As of now, clean action execution succeeds and is tracked as part of "failedDeleteFiles". But if files to be deleted does not exists or already cleaned up, we are good. but if file deletion fails due to some other exception, we can't go past the issue. It could cause data consistency issues once the commit of interest goes into archived timeline (specifically incase of replace commits). So, this patch fixes the flow, where in clean action executor will ensure all intended files will be deleted for sure. On any exception, clean execution will fail. 

Added tests to cover below scenario:
1. fs.delete returns true
2. fs.delete returns false. fs.exists returns false
3. fs.delete return false, fs.exists returns true (clean execution is expected to fail)
4. fs.delete throws FileNotFoundException
5. fs.delete throws Runtime exception (clean execution is expected to fail)

### Impact

Robust clean action. 

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

### Documentation Update

title: [HUDI-7809] Use Spark SerializableConfiguration to avoid NPE in Kryo serde
body:
### Change Logs

PR targeting master: https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/11355
This PR targets at `branch-0.x` with the same set of changes.

With Hudi 0.14.1 release, without the Spark config `spark.kryo.registrator=org.apache.spark.HoodieSparkKryoRegistrar`, Hudi queries in the Hudi Spark quick start guide succeed. In Hudi 0.15.0-rc2, without the Kryo registratrar, the Hudi queries start to throw NPE (see the stacktrace below), due to `HadoopStorageConfiguration` not properly broadcasted and serded. title: [HUDI-7507] Adding timestamp ordering validation before creating requested instant
body:
### Change Logs

When multiple writers trigger table services, there is a chance that one of them could create requested in a different ordering compared to the actual timestamp. Linkedin jira has more details of the scenario w/ an illustration. This patch, ensure that before creating a requested entry in the timeline, there is no other instant greater than the current instant time. 

Major reason is, a writer could generate a new commit time in memory (say t10), and then take a long time to do some computation and eventually add the requested instant to timeline very late (say t100). In b/w these two time, there could be another concurrent writer choosing t25 as commit time and proceed. This might lead to unexpected behaviors as called out in the jira.


### Impact

No unintended gaps wrt multi-writers and timestamp ordering intricacies. 

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

### Documentation Update

_Describe any necessary documentation update if there is any new feature, config, or user-facing change. If not, put "none"._

title: [HUDI-7655] Ensuring clean action executor cleans up all intended files
body:
### Change Logs

We can't let clean action executor skip files to be deleted. Due to networking glitches, there are chances some files may not be cleaned up. As of now, clean action execution succeeds and is tracked as part of "failedDeleteFiles". But if files to be deleted does not exists or already cleaned up, we are good. but if file deletion fails due to some other exception, we can't go past the issue. It could cause data consistency issues once the commit of interest goes into archived timeline (specifically incase of replace commits). So, this patch fixes the flow, where in clean action executor will ensure all intended files will be deleted for sure. On any exception, clean execution will fail. 

Added tests to cover below scenario:
1. fs.delete returns true
2. fs.delete returns false. fs.exists returns false
3. fs.delete return false, fs.exists returns true (clean execution is expected to fail)
4. fs.delete throws FileNotFoundException
5. fs.delete throws Runtime exception (clean execution is expected to fail)

### Impact

Robust clean action. 

### Risk level (write none, low medium or high below)

low

### Documentation Update

_Describe any necessary documentation update if there is any new feature, config, or user-facing change. If not, put "none"._

title: [HUDI-7802] Fix bundle validation scripts
body:
### Change Logs

PR targeting master: https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/11314
This PR targets at `branch-0.x` with the same changes.

This PR makes several fixes to the bundle validation scripts:
- `.github/workflows/release_candidate_validation.yml`
  - Adds Spark 3.5 and Scala 2.13 validation
  - Removes ignored paths to avoid CI actions being cancelled
- `packaging/bundle-validation/ci_run.sh`
  - Uses `STAGING_REPO_NUM` to determine whether to validate built bundle jars or release candidate jars
  - Fixes Spark 3.5 and Scala 2.13 validation
- `scripts/release/validate_staged_bundles.sh`
  - Adds new bundle jars to validate
  - Makes curl requests parallelized to save time

### Impact

Improves bundle validation scripts.
